CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 22, 1971, pg. 1 reads: "The Ruins Of Rodman - Charred walls and windows are all left of the once beautiful and historic Rodman Street Baptist Church, East Liberty, which was gutted by a six-alarm fire of unknown origin last week and caused damage estimated at $1-million. Heartache and disappointment which grips the hearts of the Rodman family is also reflected in the face of the shepherd of the flock, Rev. George L. Bowick, inset.  Below, the pastor and an unidentified fireman look over the ruins. (Harris Photo)
TitMainTitle: Rev. George L. Bowick, right, standing in front of Rodman Street Baptist Church after fire, corner of Rodman and Collins Streets, East Liberty
